Dòmine: et refúgium meum
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: et liberátor meus. Deus meus adjútor meus
O Lord: et sperábo in eum~; protéctor meus
column6: et suscèptor meus. ^ The Lord is my firmament
column8: and my deliverer. My God is my helper
column9: and in him will I put my trust; my protector
column10: and the horn of my salvation

Dòmine: et ab inimícîs meîs salvus èro. ^ Praising
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: I will call upon the Lord
O Lord: and I shall be saved from my enemies.

Dòmine: et torrèntes iniqŭitátis conturbavérunt me. ^ The sorrows of death surrounded me
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: and the torrents of iniquity troubled me.

2 ^ Díligem te: 6 ^ Dolóres infèrni circumdedérunt me~; praĕoccupavérunt me láquei mortis. ^ The sorrows of hell encompassed me; the snares of death prevented me.

Dòmine: et ad Deum meum clamávi~; exaŭdívit de templo sancto suo vocem meam
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: et clamor meus in conspèctu ejus introíbit in aŭres ejus. ^ In my affliction I called upon the Lord
O Lord: and I cried to my God; he heard my voice from his holy temple
and my cry before him will enter into his ears.

Dòmine: et contrèmuit terra~; fundamènta mòntium conturbáta sùnt
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: et commóta sùnt
O Lord: qŭóniam irátus èst eîs. ^ The earth shook and trembled; the foundations of the mountains were troubled
column6: because he was angry with them.

Dòmine: et ìgnis a fácie ejus exársit~; carbónes succènsi sùnt ab eo. ^ There went up a smoke in his wrath
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: and a fire flamed from his face; coals were kindled by it.

Dòmine: et descènsit
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: et calígo sùb pèdibus ejus. ^ He bowed the heavens
and darkness was under his feet.

Dòmine: et vulávit~; vulávit super pennas ventórum. ^ And he ascended upon the cherubim
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: and he flew; he flew upon the wings of the winds.

Dòmine: in circùmitu ejus tabernáculum ejus~; tenebrósa aqŭa in núbibus aĕris. ^ And he made darkness his cover
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: his pavilion round about him; dark water in the clouds of the air.

2 ^ Díligem te: 13 ^ Praĕ fulgóre in conspèctu ejus nubes transivérunt~; grando et carbónes ìgnis. ^ At the brightness that was before him the clouds passed; hail and coals of fire.

Dòmine: et Altìssimus dèdit vocem suam~; grando et carbónes ìgnis. ^ And the Lord thundered from heaven
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: and the Highest gave his voice; hail and coals of fire.

Dòmine: et dissipávit eos~; fùlgura multiplicávit
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: et conturbávit eos. ^ And he sent forth his arrows
O Lord: and he scattered them; he multiplied lightnings

Dòmine: et reveláta sùnt fundamènta orbis terrárum~; ab increpatióne tua
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: Dòmine
O Lord: ab inspiratióne spíritûs iraĕ tuaĕ. ^ Then the fountains of waters appeared
and the foundations of the world were discovered; at thy rebuke
column7: at the blast of the spirit of thy wrath.

Dòmine: et accépit me
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: et assúmpsit me de aqŭîs mùltîs. ^ He sent from on high
and received me out of many waters.

2 ^ Díligem te: 18 ^ Erìpuit me de inimícîs meîs fortìssimîs
Dòmine: et ab hîs qŭi odérunt me
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: qŭóniam confortáti sùnt super me. ^ He delivered me from my strongest enemies
O Lord: and from them that hated me
for they were too strong for me.

2 ^ Díligem te: 19 ^ Praĕvenérunt me in die afflictiónis meaĕ
Dòmine: et factus èst Dòminus protéctor meus. ^ They prevented me in the day of my affliction
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: and the Lord became my protector.

2 ^ Díligem te: 20 ^ Et edúxit me in latitúdinem~; salvum me fecit
Dòmine: qŭóniam vóluit me. ^ And he brought me forth into a large place; he saved me
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: because he was well pleased with me.

2 ^ Díligem te: 21 ^ Et retrìbuet mìhi Dòminus secùndum justìtiam meam
Dòmine: et secùndum puritátem mánuum meárum retrìbuet mìhi
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: ^ And the Lord will reward me according to my justice; and will repay me according to the cleanness of my hands

Dòmine: nec ìmpie gessi a Deo meo
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: ^ because I have kept the ways of the Lord
O Lord: and have not done wickedly against my God

2 ^ Díligem te: 23 ^ qŭóniam òmnia judìcia ejus in conspèctu meo
Dòmine: et justìtias ejus non rèpuli a me. ^ for all his judgments are in my sight
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: and his justices I have not put away from me.

Dòmine: et observábo me ab iniqŭitáte mea. ^ And I shall be spotless with him
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: and shall keep myself from my iniquity.

2 ^ Díligem te: 25 ^ Et retrìbuet mìhi Dòminus secùndum justìtiam meam
Dòmine: et secùndum puritátem mánuum meárum in conspèctu oculórum ejus. ^ And the Lord will reward me according to my justice
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: and according to the cleanness of my hands before his eyes.

Dòmine: et cùm vìro innocènte ìnnocens èris
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: ^ With the holy thou wilt be holy
O Lord: and with the innocent man thou wilt be innocent

Dòmine: et cùm pervèrso pervèrteris. ^ and with the elect thou wilt be elect
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: and with the perverse thou wilt be perverted.

2 ^ Díligem te: 28 ^ Qŭóniam tu pòpulum húmilem salvum fácies
Dòmine: et òculos superbórum humiliábis. ^ For thou wilt save the humble people
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: but wilt bring down the eyes of the proud.

Dòmine: Dòmine~; Deus meus
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: illúmina tènebras meas. ^ For thou lightest my lamp

2 ^ Díligem te: 30 ^ Qŭóniam in te erìpier a tentatióne
Dòmine: et in Deo meo transgrédier murum. ^ For by thee I shall be delivered from temptation
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: and through my God I shall go over a wall.

Dòmine: impollúta via ejus~; elóqŭia Dòmini ìgne examináta~; protéctor èst òmnium sperántium in se. ^ As for my God
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: his way is undefiled; the words of the Lord are fire-tried; he is the protector of all that trust in him.

2 ^ Díligem te: 32 ^ ¿~Qŭóniam qŭìs Deus praĕter Dòminum~? ¿~Aŭt qŭìs Deus praĕter Deum nostrum~? ^ For who is God but the Lord~? Or who is God but our God~?

Dòmine: et pósuit immaculátam viam meam~; ^ God
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: who hath girt me with strength

2 ^ Díligem te: 34 ^ qŭi perfécit pèdes meos tamqŭam cervórum
Dòmine: et super excèlsa státuens me~; ^ who hath made my feet like the feet of harts
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: and who setteth me upon high places;

2 ^ Díligem te: 35 ^ qŭi dòcet manûs meas ad práĕlium
Dòmine: et posuìsti
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: ut arcum áĕreum
O Lord: bráchia mea. ^ who teacheth my hands to war

2 ^ Díligem te: 36 ^ Et dedìsti mìhi protectiónem salútis tuaĕ
Dòmine: et dèxtera tua suscépit me
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: et disciplína tua corréxit me in finem
O Lord: et disciplína tua ìpsa me docébit. ^ And thou hast given me the protection of thy salvation
and thy right hand hath held me up
column6: and thy discipline hath corrected me unto the end
column7: and thy discipline itself shall teach me.

Dòmine: et non sùnt infirmáta vestígia mea. ^ Thou hast enlarged my steps under me
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: and my feet are not weakened.

2 ^ Díligem te: 38 ^ Pèrsequer inimícos meos et comprehèndem illos
Dòmine: et non convèrter donec defìciant. ^ I will pursue after my enemies and overtake them
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: and I will not turn again till they are consumed.

Dòmine: nec póterunt stare~; cadent subtus pèdes meos. ^ I will break them
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: and they shall not be able to stand; they shall fall under my feet.

2 ^ Díligem te: 40 ^ Et praĕcinxìsti me virtúte ad bellum
Dòmine: et supplantavìsti insurgèntes in me subtus me. ^ And thou hast girded me with strength unto battle
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: and hast subdued under me them that rose up against me.

2 ^ Díligem te: 41 ^ Et inimícos meos dedìsti mìhi dorsum
Dòmine: et odièntes me disperdidìsti. ^ And thou hast made my enemies turn their back upon me
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: and hast destroyed them that hated me.

Dòmine: nec èrat qŭi salvos fáceret
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: ad Dòminum
but there was none to save them

Dòmine: ut pùlverem ante fáciem vènti~; ut lutum plateárum delébo eos. ^ And I shall beat them as small as the dust before the wind; like the dirt of the streets I shall bring them to nought.

2 ^ Díligem te: 44 ^ Erìpies me de contradictiónibus pòpuli~; constìtues me in caput gèntium. ^ Thou wilt deliver me from the contradictions of the people; thou wilt make me head of the Gentiles.

Dòmine: servívit mìhi~; in aŭdítu aŭris obedívit mìhi. ^ A people which I knew not
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: hath served me; at the hearing of the ear they have obeyed me.

2 ^ Díligem te: 46 ^ Fílii aliéni mentíti sùnt mìhi~; fílii aliéni inveteráti sùnt et claŭdicavérunt a sémitîs suîs. ^ The children that are strangers have lied to me; strange children have faded away and have halted from their paths.

Dòmine: et benedìctus Deus meus
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: et exaltétur Deus salútis meaĕ. ^ The Lord liveth
and let the God of my salvation be exalted.

2 ^ Díligem te: 48 ^ Deus qŭi das vindìctas mìhi et subdis pòpulos sùb me~; liberátor meus de inimícîs meîs iracùndîs. ^ The God who avengest me and subduest the people under me; my deliverer from my enraged enemies.
49 ^ Et ab insurgèntibus in me exaltábis me~; a vìro iníqŭo erìpies me. ^ And thou wilt lift me up above them that rise up against me; from the unjust man thou wilt deliver me.

Dòmine: Dòmine
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: et nómini tuo psalmum dicem
O Lord: ^ Therefore will I give glory to thee among the nations
column6: and I will sing a psalm to thy name

Dòmine: et fáciens misericórdiam christo suo Davídi
fortitúdo mea. ^ I will love thee: et sémini ejus usqŭe in sáĕculum. ^ giving great deliverance to his king
O Lord: and showing mercy to David his anointed
and to his seed for ever.
